form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Coons (for himself, Mrs. Shaheen, Ms. Collins, and Mr. Reed) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Energy Conservation and Production Act to reauthorize the weatherization assistance program.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Energy Savings and Weatherization Reauthorization Act of 2025.

subsection.text: Section 422(2) of the Energy Conservation and Production Act (42 U.S.C. 6872(2)) is amended by striking 2025 and inserting 2030.
Section 412 of the Energy Conservation and Production Act (42 U.S.C. 6862) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (1), (2), (3), (8), and (9) as paragraphs (8), (1), (2), (9), and (10), respectively, and reordering accordingly; and
by inserting after paragraph (2) (as so redesignated) the following:
The term fully weatherized, with respect to a dwelling unit, means that—

subparagraph.text: the recommended measures from an energy audit tool approved by the Secretary or a priority list are installed in that dwelling unit; and
the dwelling unit has received a final quality control inspection.

subsection.text: Section 415(c) of the Energy Conservation and Production Act (42 U.S.C. 6865(c)) is amended—

clause.text: in the first sentence, by striking $6,500 and inserting $15,000; and
by striking (c)(1) Except as provided in paragraphs (3) and (4) and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraphs (3), (4), and (6)

subparagraph.text: by conforming the margins of subparagraphs (A) through (D) to the margin of subparagraph (E);
in subparagraph (D), by striking , and and inserting ; and; and
in subparagraph (E), by adding a period at the end;

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), in the first sentence, by striking weatherized (including dwelling units partially weatherized) and inserting fully weatherized;
in paragraph (4), by striking $3,000 and inserting $6,000;

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A)(i), by striking (6)(A)(ii) and inserting (7)(A)(ii); and
by striking (6)(A)(i)(I) each place it appears and inserting (7)(A)(i)(I);

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (6) as paragraph (7); and
by inserting after paragraph (5) the following:

The Secretary may increase the amount of financial assistance provided per dwelling unit under this part beyond the limit specified in paragraph (1) if the Secretary determines that market conditions require such an increase to achieve the purposes of this part.

subsection.text: Section 414D(b)(1)(C) of the Energy Conservation and Production Act (42 U.S.C. 6864d(b)(1)(C)) is amended by striking 415(c)(6)(A) and inserting 415(c)(7)(A).
